sentences.en: A few. But their work almost inevitably treated with disdain by the jaded reviewers.
sentences.cn: 是的, 而且他们的作品几乎不可避免的受到那些迟钝评论家的讥讽.

sentences.en: Check the life, which can soothe jangly nerves and sharpen jaded minds.
sentences.cn: 经常清点生活, 可以抚慰心烦意乱的神经和疲惫不堪的神志.

sentences.en: Even an exquisitely prepared dinner couldn't revive her jaded palate.
sentences.cn: 即使是一顿精心准备的晚餐也不能恢复她吃腻了的胃口.

sentences.en: Here is a dish that will revive jaded palates.
sentences.cn: 这道菜简直可以恢复迟钝的味觉.

sentences.en: I felt terribly jaded after working all weekend.
sentences.cn: 整个周末工作之后我感到疲惫不堪。

sentences.en: Maybe I'm just feeling kinda old and jaded.
sentences.cn: 也许我只是觉得自己有点老了也疲倦了.

sentences.en: Or will the voters just jaded about politics?
sentences.cn: 选民对政治会不会因此感到疲乏?

sentences.en: Surely only the most jaded and damaged would challenge the orthodoxy of romantic love.
sentences.cn: 当然,只有那些最厌倦和最受伤害的女士们才会挑战浪漫爱情的正统.

sentences.en: The concert should satisfy even the most jaded critic.
sentences.cn: 这场音乐会应该能让最不易打动的评论家都觉得满意。

sentences.en: The odoriferous spices stimulated her jaded appetite.
sentences.cn: 香料的芬芳刺激她疲惫的胃口.

sentences.en: They must n't worry; they must sleep and rest stole into their jaded bones.
sentences.cn: 他们不用担心, 他们必须睡觉,于是他们疲惫不堪的筋骨不知不觉地松弛了.

sentences.en: We had both become jaded, disinterested, and disillusioned.
sentences.cn: 我们俩都已经倦了，腻了，也死心了。

sentences.en: When it comes to politics I'm pretty jaded I don't believe anything that any politician says.
sentences.cn: 对政治我很有成见.我不相信任何政客的高谈阔论.

sentences.en: You look very jaded; you need a holiday.
sentences.cn: 你看上去劳累不堪, 该休休假了.

trans.tran_cn: 精疲力竭的，厌倦的，（因过饱或过多而）腻烦的，迟钝的
trans.tran_en: someone who is jaded is no longer interested in or excited by something, usually because they have experienced too much of it

trans.tran_cn: 厌倦（jade的过去分词）；变得疲倦；精疲力竭
